intro: Cypella herbertii subsp. reflexa, commonly known as the Herbert's cypella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
